fields.comment: I’m deaf in one ear, and the transcription feature is amazing — it helps me catch everything I missed. Sometimes the punctuation is weird, but it’s way better than nothing. Works well with my external keyboard too."

As someone with limited mobility in my hands, I really appreciate Notion’s keyboard shortcuts and customizable templates. I can navigate most of my work without reaching for the mouse, which makes organizing notes way easier than I thought. Only thing missing is a better screen reader labeling, but overall super helpful!

I like Notion for planning, but as a colorblind user, I find some of the highlighted labels hard to distinguish. They could defintely improve contrast and offer colorblind-friendly themes. Otherwise, it’s functional and I can manage most tasks."

Screen reader support is kinda messy. Some buttons dont have proper labels, and navigating tables is confusing. I love the idea of Notion but using it blind is really frustrating. Hope they fix it soon.
